description:
Rio di Bueda is one of the less known canyons in Friuli. It is of medium difficulty, armed in expedition style. It is in green environment with some beautiful narrowings in dolomite.

Zone: Friuli – Udine – Arta Terme (Zuglio)

Qualities: Entrance: 800 m Exit: 450 m Height: 350 m Length: 1600 m

Period May-October

Times: Approach: 10 min Progression: 3-4 h Return: 10 min

Shuttle: Yes (4,5 km)

Equipment: Expedition (insufficient) – multi monti speeds (6mm) and natural weapons

Rope: 1 x 40m

Biggest waterfall: 15 m

Possible exit Yes. When you reach the stone bridge, follow the path 162.

Maps: Tabacco Number 13

Attraction: Local

Headwaters: 2,6o km2

Difficulty: V3 a3 IV

Approach

From Tolmezzo drive 7 km to Zuglio. Leave the first car near the bridge across Rio di Bueda. Then continue towards Fielis. Where you reach the first houses of the village, you see the crossroad with the dirt road coming from the left side (there is also a bench). There is enough space to leave the second car.

Follow the dirt road going to the left and downhill untill you reach the waterbed after 10 minutes.

Descent

300 m walking (5 min)

C 12m: 2 spits (6mm) with nylon track (R)

C 8m: tree (L)

D 5m (R)

C 10m: rope around the stone (R)

C 6m: one spit (R)

D 3m (L)

100m D

walking

D 5m 5m (R)

C 7m: rope around the stone (L)

T 5m

C 15m (2 cascades): spit (R)

100m D

D 4m (R)

walking

C 10m: spit (R)

100m walking

Stone bridge with possible exit

C 7m: 1 spit (L)

D 4m (R) - waterbasin

D 5m (center)

C 9m (2 cascades): iron sticks of the pipe line (L) / Sp! 4m 5m

C 12m: iron sticks with the rope (L)

100m walking


C = cascate D = down climb T = tobogan, slide L = left R = right S = shout

Exit

Leave the canyon on the iron gallery on the right side (10min).

Red tape

Beta sites

  • Canyon.Carto.net  : Rio di Bueda
  • Catastoforre AIC-Canyoning.it  : Rio di Bueda
  • Canyoneast.it  : BUEDA

Trip reports and media

Background

The canyon is equipped with multi monti spits (6mm). We went through the canyon with new Corda Dana 10 mm ropes, but it is equipped for 9mm rope. We recommend you to have some rope and nylon tracks for the rappeling points. There are 9-10 rappeling points in the canyon.
name: Bueda
